org.apache.derbyTesting.perf.clients

Interface LoadGenerator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BackToBackLoadGenerator, PoissonLoadGenerator

    public interface LoadGenerator
    Interface implemented by load generators. A load generator generates the test load on the DBMS by invoking the clients' doWork() methods. Different load generators may generate load with different characteristics. The actual database operations performed are decided by the clients passed in to the load generator's init() method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Initialize the load generator.
      void printReport(java.io.PrintStream out)
      Print a report from the test run.
      void startSteadyState()
      Move from the warmup phase to the steady-state phase.
      void startWarmup()

      void stop()
      Stop the load generator.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(Client[] clients)
        Initialize the load generator.
        Parameters:
        clients - tells the load generator which clients it should use to generate load with

      • startWarmup

        void startWarmup()
        Start the warmup phase. This means that the load generator is started, but the results are not collected.

      • startSteadyState

        void startSteadyState()
        Move from the warmup phase to the steady-state phase. Start collecting results.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop the load generator.

      • printReport

        void printReport(java.io.PrintStream out)
        Print a report from the test run.
        Parameters:
        out - stream to print the report to
